pullRequest.title: [WFLY-14148]: Move microprofile opentracing from wildfly-ee to wildfly.
pullRequest.bodyText:
removing opentracing from the ee feature pack and moving it to the
complete feature pack.

Jira: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/WFLY-14148

nodes.bodyText: This should remain. The wildfly-preview feature pack includes all the MP specs.
This should remain. The wildfly-preview feature pack includes all the MP specs.
I forget -- why doesn't the layer define this this way?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -7,10 +7,19 @@
         <include name="microprofile-fault-tolerance"/>
         <include name="microprofile-jwt"/>
         <include name="microprofile-openapi"/>
+        <include name="open-tracing"/>
         <include name="undertow-legacy-https"/>
         <exclude name="management-security-realm"/>
         <exclude name="jpa"/>
         <include name="jpa-distributed"/>
         <include name="web-clustering"/>
     </layers>
+    <feature spec="subsystem.microprofile-opentracing-smallrye">
+        <param name="default-tracer" value="jaeger"/>
+        <feature spec="subsystem.microprofile-opentracing-smallrye.jaeger-tracer">
+            <param name="jaeger-tracer" value="jaeger"/>
+            <param name="sampler-param" value="1"/>
+            <param name="sampler-type" value="const"/>
+        </feature>
+    </feature>

nodes.bodyText: If this config chunk ends up being needed in more than one place, create a feature group for it.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -7,12 +7,21 @@
         <include name="microprofile-fault-tolerance"/>
         <include name="microprofile-jwt"/>
         <include name="microprofile-openapi"/>
+        <include name="open-tracing"/>
         <include name="undertow-legacy-https"/>
         <exclude name="management-security-realm"/>
     </layers>
     <!-- TODO WFLY-13150 encapsulate these in a layer -->
     <feature-group name="distributable-web"/>
     <feature-group name="infinispan-local-web"/>
+    <feature spec="subsystem.microprofile-opentracing-smallrye">
+        <param name="default-tracer" value="jaeger"/>
+        <feature spec="subsystem.microprofile-opentracing-smallrye.jaeger-tracer">
+            <param name="jaeger-tracer" value="jaeger"/>
+            <param name="sampler-param" value="1"/>
+            <param name="sampler-type" value="const"/>
+        </feature>
+    </feature>

beforeCommit.message:
[WFLY-14148]: Move microprofile opentracing from wildfly-ee to wildfly.

* removing opentracing from the ee feature pack and moving it to the
  complete feature pack.

Jira: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/WFLY-14148

afterCommit.message:
[WFLY-14148]: Move microprofile opentracing from wildfly-ee to wildfly.

* removing opentracing from the ee feature pack and moving it to the complete feature pack.
* fixing the test suite to take into account both kind of configuration
  (layers vs full).
* removing the need for commons-lang3 in some tests.

Jira: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/WFLY-14148

nodes.bodyText: The current standalone-microprofile-ha.xml uses the empty config.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -7,10 +7,12 @@
         <include name="microprofile-fault-tolerance"/>
         <include name="microprofile-jwt"/>
         <include name="microprofile-openapi"/>
+        <include name="microprofile-opentracing"/>
         <include name="undertow-legacy-https"/>
         <exclude name="management-security-realm"/>
         <exclude name="jpa"/>
         <include name="jpa-distributed"/>
         <include name="web-clustering"/>
     </layers>
+    <feature-group name="microprofile-opentracing-jaeger"/>

nodes.bodyText: The current standalone-microprofile-ha.xml uses the empty config.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -7,12 +7,14 @@
         <include name="microprofile-fault-tolerance"/>
         <include name="microprofile-jwt"/>
         <include name="microprofile-openapi"/>
+        <include name="microprofile-opentracing"/>
         <include name="undertow-legacy-https"/>
         <exclude name="management-security-realm"/>
     </layers>
     <!-- TODO WFLY-13150 encapsulate these in a layer -->
     <feature-group name="distributable-web"/>
     <feature-group name="infinispan-local-web"/>
+    <feature-group name="microprofile-opentracing-jaeger"/>

nodes.bodyText:
I think inverting this is more useful (i.e. microprofile-opentracing depends open-tracing, with open-tracing having the features). In any case where the user adds either, it works. If anyone uses one of our aggregate layers, like microprofile-platform or observability, if they exclude either one it works.
The microprofile-opentracing would have to optionally depend open-tracing though; otherwise you could not exclude open-tracing.
In WF 24 we could drop open-tracing.

afterCommit.message:
[WFLY-14148]: Move microprofile opentracing from wildfly-ee to wildfly.

* removing opentracing from the ee feature pack and moving it to the complete feature pack.
* fixing the test suite to take into account both kind of configuration
  (layers vs full).
* removing the need for commons-lang3 in some tests.
* removing OnOffOpenTracingTestCase as it should require a restart and not just a reload of the server.

Jira: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/WFLY-14148

nodes.bodyText:
@bstansberry is that intended?
I thought that MP specs would be made available only in the standalone-microprofile configurations even for EE9
that one might not be correct (see #13806 (comment))
